comments.body:
Previously, the `RocksDbWindowBytesStoreSupplier` constructor enforced the minimum of 2, so if you passed `< 1`, you'd get an exception from here, and if you passed `<2`, you'd get the exception from the constructor called just below here.

This way, we collapse both checks into one equivalent check here.
I've added this check since I removed it from the DSL builder.
nit: fix indention

This indentation is actually "correct" according to the IDEA defaults (a continuation of string concatenation gets indented).

Is that ok with you, or do you want me to update my formatter?
We usually don't indent but align -- at least, all other code is formatter like this IIRC. But it's a nit anyway...

Gah! We missed deprecating this method's counterpart (`persistentSessionStore(String, long)`) during KIP review.

@mjsax , can we just amend the KIP now and deprecate the method in this PR?
I think updating the KIP is fine. It's a minor change. Nice catch @vvcephei!

@vvcephei 
I've updated [KIP-358](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-358%3A+Migrate+Streams+API+to+Duration+instead+of+long+ms+times) based on your comment
add `@throws` for `IllegalArgumentException`
add `@deprecated` JavaDoc
This is part of KIP-358 but slipped in the PR
Oof. Thanks.
Mentioning this on the KIP slipped.
Mentioning this on the KIP slipped.
just move up there (from further down)
Could you use more meaningful names for these variables? Especially for `rpMsgPrefix` and `wsMsgPrefix`.
This PR just moves this code around. But I agree. Will fix.
I would move line 328 and 329 to before this line.
I would move line 330 and 331 to before this line.
See above my comment about internal classes in javadocs.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +147,151 @@     * This store supplier can be passed into a {@link #keyValueStoreBuilder(KeyValueBytesStoreSupplier, Serde, Serde)}
     * or {@link #timestampedKeyValueStoreBuilder(KeyValueBytesStoreSupplier, Serde, Serde)}.
     *
     * @param name          name of the store (cannot be {@code null})
     * @param maxCacheSize  maximum number of items in the LRU (cannot be negative)
